cookingMethodOne:
1. Preheat oven to 400°F (205°C). 
2. Cut off the top of a head of garlic to expose the cloves. Drizzle with olive oil, wrap in foil and bake for 30-35 minutes. 
3. In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat.
recipeNameTwo: Baked Salmon with Lemon and Dill
cookingMethodTwo:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). 
2. Season salmon fillets with salt and black pepper. Place on a baking sheet. 
3. In a small bowl, mix together melted butter, lemon juice, dill, and garlic. Spoon the mixture over the salmon. 
4. Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until salmon flakes easily with a fork. 
5. Serve hot.
cookingMethodThree:
1. Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside. 
2. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until no longer pink. 
3. Add garlic and cook for an additional minute. 
4. Stir in heavy cream, Parmesan cheese, salt, and black pepper. Bring to a simmer and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened. 
5. Add cooked pasta to the skillet and toss to coat in the sauce. 
6. Serve hot.
ingredientsThree: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces,
bio: John Smith is an Israeli-British chef, restaurateur, and cookbook author. He is known for his creative use of vegetables and his focus on Middle Eastern flavors. Ottolenghi has several popular restaurants in London and has written several bestselling cookbooks.

bio: Linda Chen is an Israeli-British chef, restaurateur, and cookbook author. He is known for his creative use of vegetables and his focus on Middle Eastern flavors. Ottolenghi has several popular restaurants in London and has written several bestselling cookbooks.

cookingMethodOne:
1. Preheat oven to 400°F (205°C). 
2. Cut off the top of a head of garlic to expose the cloves. Drizzle with olive oil, wrap in foil and bake for 30-35 minutes. 
3. In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add onions and carrots and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until vegetables are softened. 
4. Add canned tomatoes, roasted garlic, chicken broth, and Italian seasoning. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 20 minutes. 
5. Use an immersion blender to puree the soup until smooth. Season with salt and black pepper to taste. 
6. Serve hot.
